docs.snippet: FROM THE TWO GREAT ARMIES  Advices from Gen. HALLEOK'S army, dated yesterday, and from Gen McCLELLAN'S army, dated to-day, have been received at the War Department. The former was in close proximity to the enemy, but no engagement had taken place....

headline.main: NEWS FROM WASHINGTON.; THE PROCLAMATION OF GEN. HUNTER. HIS IMMEDIATE RECALL PROBABLE. OUR SPECIAL WASHINGTON DISPATCHES.

docs.lead_paragraph: FROM THE TWO GREAT ARMIES Advices from Gen. HALLEOK'S army, dated yesterday, and from Gen McCLELLAN'S army, dated to-day, have been received at the War Department. The former was in close proximity to the enemy, but no engagement had taken place. The latter was consentrating, and bringing up supplies, preparatory to a movement.

docs.snippet: The capture of Pensacola is announced in a dispatch from Gen. HALLECK'S army. This news was brought to the Union lines, from Corinth, under a flag of truce.
docs.lead_paragraph: The capture of Pensacola is announced in a dispatch from Gen. HALLECK'S army. This news was brought to the Union lines, from Corinth, under a flag of truce.

docs.snippet: The reception of Parson BROWNLOW at the Academy of Music, last evening, was a decided success. The building was crammed, and the stage was filled with distinguished citizens of all parties. WM. M. EVARTS, Esq., presided. Parson effective and...
docs.lead_paragraph: The reception of Parson BROWNLOW at the Academy of Music, last evening, was a decided success. The building was crammed, and the stage was filled with distinguished citizens of all parties. WM. M. EVARTS, Esq., presided. Parson effective and characteristic strain, and was applanded to the echo. His most fervent hope was to be able to help hang the rebels of Tennessee.

headline.main: GEN. HALLECK'S ARMY.; The Passage of the Tennessee Gen. Pope's Army Marks of he Battle Sensation Stories Rolles of the Field Consequences of a Change in Command.

docs.lead_paragraph: The above superscription may seem somewhat formulable in regard to length, but it is the only one that will convey even an approximate idea of the army and your correspondent's locality. "In the woods," means about six miles from Pittsburgh, and five miles from Hamburgh the latter, a beautiful lit- tle town on the west bank of the Tennessee River, and at present the headquarters of Gen. POPE.
